sentences.sContent: Most of the criticism has been pretty tame.
sentences.sCn: 评论的大部分内容很乏味。

sentences.sContent: I decided that teaching was too tame for me.
sentences.sCn: 我最终认为教书对我来说太枯燥。

sentences.sContent: ...Parliament has in fact already authorized the government to tame the tobacco trade...
...India's normally tame middle class is speaking up against social ills...

synos.tran: 驯服的；平淡的；乏味的；顺从的

words.tran: 驯服地，温顺地；没骨气地

trans.tranCn: 驯服的，顺从的；沉闷的，乏味的
制服， 控制并利用； 驯化， 驯服
trans.tranOther: to reduce the power or strength of something and prevent it from causing trouble
